text: Jean-Jacques Bréard (October 1751- January 2, 1840) was born into a family of a navy inspectors. He moved to France as a young boy in 1758. His first involvement in politics included organizing elections to the Estates General in Marennes and President of the National Convention Category:1751 births Category:1840 deaths Category:Presidents of the National Convention
title: Jean-Jacques Bréard
